author: Ian Coyle
text:
Assessing improved methods to compensate management (unrepresented employees such as Directors, Department Heads, etc).  
In years past, they have been provided an across-the-board increase of say 3%. 
I favor something less general and more synchronized with overall, orgnaizational performance.  I see how a scorecard of various factors leading to a percentage increase could work.  
Looking for some examples of best practices and management compensation policies/plans that reward strong departmental performance but are not administratively nightmarish. 
Thanks.
title: Management Compensation
